isis.stitle: Spanish - Guía para Localización de Fallas del Sistema Eléctrico - 3200, 4200, 4300, 4400, 7300, 7400, 7500, 8500, 8600 - POWER STEERING GEAR: SHEPPARD MODEL 292, 392, 492 - REASSEMBLE - ACTUATING SHAFT AND BEARING CAP SEALS

svcproc.title: ACTUATING SHAFT AND BEARING CAP SEALS

step1.para: Place the backup washer in the bearing cap with the undercut down as shown ( Figure 98).

figure.caption: Figure 98. Place Backup Washer in Bearing Cap

step1.para: Take a piece of round stock 2 inches long and turn to 1.615 inches O.D. and smooth on one end.

Put the piece of round stock in the bearing end against the backup washer, or against the shoulder area for the high pressure seal if a backup washer is not used. Set the bearing cap on a press and evenly install the dirt seal, lip out from the other end until it rests against the backup washer or the round stock as shown ( Figure 99).
Evenly install the salt seal, lip out, into the bearing cap until flush with top.
Turn bearing cap over when replacing the high pressure seal as pictured above with a duplicate seal. The backup washer must be installed with the undercut down as shown in Figure 98.
When replacing the high pressure seal, the original backup washer must be discarded, as the new high pressure teflon seal kit has the backup washer built in.
Evenly install the high pressure oil seal until it rests against the backup washer or the shoulder.
Lubricate all three seals with grease before installing actuating shaft assembly.

note.para: If the backup washer is not installed properly, an oil leak will occur on the first application of pressure.

step1.para: Press the actuating shaft into the bearing cap. Re-install the bearing retainer. Tighten retainer securely to keep the bearing from having end play. Install a new lock pin and peen it in place ( Figure 100).
